channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: My solution to Trump’s tariffs: I’m starting a U.S. factory to save my small business
item.description: Supply chains for consumer goods don't have to be overseas, and the benefits to producing in the U.S. extend beyond tariffs.

item.title: ‘Superfine’ Brings Radiant Black Style to the Met
item.description: Heritage meets gumption at the Costume Institute’s big spring exhibition, where pathbreaking pieces join anonymous garments to build a moving history.

item.title: An Apple exec suggested AI chatbots were eroding Google’s search business, sending Alphabet shares plummeting. The truth is more complicated.
item.description: Alphabet execs insist search volumes are up, but market share is slipping and revenue growth appears to be slowing.

item.title: Putin Aims to Project Power at Military Parade Marking Victory Over Nazi Germany
item.description: The Russian president is seeking to use the event to depict himself as a global leader despite Western efforts to isolate him and a failure to win the...

item.title: F.D.A. Approves First At-Home Alternative to the Pap Smear
item.description: The tool will allow women to screen for HPV, which causes almost all cases of cervical cancer, without visiting a doctor.

item.title: Holocaust Museum Board Member Condemns Silence on Trump Firings
item.description: Board members clashed over email after a Biden appointee sent a scathing letter invoking the Holocaust as he denounced the museum’s silence on Preside...

item.title: Nearly 20 million jobs are on the chopping block to be replaced by AI, SHRM research shows
item.description: The report found blue-collar, service, and administrative support roles are disproportionately affected by the technology and are at higher risks than...

item.title: One of Hollywood’s top talent agents on this summer’s promising box office lineup
item.description: CAA's Maha Dakhil is optimistic about this summer's box office.

item.title: David H. Souter, Republican Justice Who Allied With Court’s Liberal Wing, Dies at 85
item.description: He left conservatives bitterly disappointed with his migration from right to left, leading to the cry of “no more Souters.”

item.title: Target foot traffic is still down after 3 months in the fallout of dismantling DEI and subsequent boycotts
item.description: Foot traffic was down 3.3% YoY in April, following dips of 6.5% in March and 9% in February, according to data from Placer.ai.

item.title: Live Updates: India-Pakistan Conflict Intensifies Into Most Expansive in Decades
item.description: Both countries reportedly aimed attacks at each other’s territories well beyond their disputed Kashmir border.

item.title: Live Updates: Leo XIV Vows to Lift Up ‘Ordinary People’ in 1st Mass as Pope
item.description: The American-born pontiff called for “missionary outreach” by the Roman Catholic Church to help heal the “wounds that afflict our society.” He will so...

item.title: When the pope was chosen, two tailors in Rome were ready.
Putin Aims to Project Power at Military Parade Marking Victory Over Nazi Germany
item.description: The Russian president is seeking to use the event to depict himself as a global leader despite Western efforts to isolate him and a failure to win the...

item.title: Trump Suggests Openness to Slashing China Tariffs Ahead of Trade Talks
item.description: The president said reducing tariffs to 80 percent from the current 145 percent “sounds right,” as U.S. and Chinese negotiators prepare to meet in Swit...
